title: [ICE] in last Nightly with copy_within

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
```rust
fn main() {
    let v = &mut [1];
    if let Some(_) = v.iter().position(|_| true) {
        v.copy_within(.., 0);
    }
}
```

Compiled with:

```
rustc --edition 2021 test3.rs
```

```
rustc 1.58.0-nightly (1af55d19c 2021-10-19)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: 1af55d19c7a9189374d89472f97dc119659bb67e
commit-date: 2021-10-19
host: x86_64-pc-windows-gnu
release: 1.58.0-nightly
LLVM version: 13.0.0
```

Gives:

```
thread 'rustc' panicked at 'called `Result::unwrap()` on an `Err` value: Utf8Error { valid_up_to: 4, error_len: Some(1) }', /rustc/1af55d19c7a9189374d89472f97dc119659bb67e\compiler\rustc_serialize\src\opaque.rs:659:85

error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic

note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.

note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md

note: rustc 1.58.0-nightly (1af55d19c 2021-10-19) running on x86_64-pc-windows-gnu

#0 [optimized_mir] optimizing MIR for `core::slice::<impl [T]>::copy_within`
```
